alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Goochland; Hanover; Henrico; King William; King and Queen; Powhatan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 23 at 9:40PM EDT until September 23 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN CHESTERFIELD, SOUTHEASTERN GOOCHLAND, HANOVER, HENRICO, CENTRAL POWHATAN, NORTHWESTERN KING AND QUEEN, KING WILLIAM AND SOUTHEASTERN CAROLINE COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF RICHMOND... At 940 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Richmond, Powhatan, Goochland, King William, Ashland, Mechanicsville, Virginia Union University, Randolph Macon College, Virginia Commonwealth University, Highland Springs, Downtown Richmond, University Of Richmond, Tuckahoe, Bon Air, Saint Stephens Church, King And Queen Court House, Hanover, Glen Allen, Lakeside and East Highland Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Goochland; Hanover; Henrico; King William; King and Queen; Powhatan
